Reviews.Content: Were there four nights, having booked via utell,com. Paid euro 101 per night, tax and breakfast included. You can also go direct to their website (---) for reservations and rate comparison. Breakfast is excellent (hot dishes, fruits, cakes, pastry, cheese, yoghurt, etc) and is located 4 blocks fron Sants train station. It has a metro station at three blocks distance, that will take you to Plaza Cataluna in 7 minutes. Small restaurants around the hotel, with local food at very reasonable prices. Not far from airport (taxi cost: euro18) Two computers and a printer are available in the lobby (called business center!!) and worked when we needed to use them

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller853
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the H10 Itaca on the recommendation of the reviews in tripadvisor.com and the great deal I got from Expedia. I was not disappointed. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the rooms clean and well maintained. There have been some reports about the variable shower temperature but I did not experience it in the four nights I stayed there. Maybe they have fixed the problem or maybe I was just lucky. A reviewer also complained about the noisy ventillation system but again I did not find this a problem. The hotel staff set the ventillation on maximum boost as a default but you can switch it to low so that your sleep is not disturbed. However, you will experience some road noise as the hotel is on a main road but the double glazing ensures that this is not a significant problem. The hotel provide a wonderful buffet breakfast but at 14 euros it is quite expensive. You could eat in a nearby cafe but I decided to splash out and didn't regret it. The food is of the highest calibre and is enough to keep you going for most of the day. I found the free access to the internet terminals quite useful where you could check your emails, the weather, timetables etc etc. And,you could stock up cheaply on supplies for the day from the supermarket right next door. This made the mini-bar rather superfluous. The location of this hotel is ideal if you are looking for somewhere away form the noise of the city centre and, dare I say it, the sort of guests who are likely to keep you awake all night. You could hear other guests, especially in the bathroom, but it was nothing to complain about. The location is also good if you are staying several nights and intend to take day trips to Stiges and Montserrat (both are worth it). Sants station is a stop for the Tourist Bus which costs 17 euros for one day and 21 euros for two days. As the tourist sites are well spaced apart, I would advise paying for this, especially if you are a first time visitor to Barcelona. Going independent, using the T tickets, is best done by those who know their way around. So, in conclusion, the H10 Itaca is an above average hotel which I thoroughly recommend. The only downside is that there is not much in the way of restaurants and entertainment in the area. However, it is easy to get into the city centre and then retreat to your hotel refuge at the end of the day. There is going to be a little walking involved (Sants station is 5 to 10 mins away) so if you are disabled or you are just plain lazy, you might prefer somewhere else. Also, if you are staying only a couple of nights you might find yourself better off at a city centre hotel like the H10 Universitat as you will want to see the main attractions quickly, but you must expect to pay a heavy price for this and your room is likely to be the size of a cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a European vacation and my first stop was Barcelona. I stayed at H10 Itaca Hotel with my 21 year old nephew ( his 1st trip abroad) After a long flight delay and being awake for nearly 24 hrs, we were greeted by a truly friendly staff and a glass of regional "champagne".The front desk staff answered all of my questions about the city clearly and consisely, and in perfect English. Our room was very clean and well decorated. There was a full bathroom filled with many toiletries for our use. The beds were comfortable and the aircondition was much appreciated. The location of the hotel was ideal: a two minute walk to the train station, a ten/fifteen minute walk to Avd. Diagonal,next to a supermarket,and in a safe neighborhood. The staff provided wake up calls and taxi's when neccessary and seemed genuinely sincere in all their efforts. The breakfast buffet was enormous and delicious. I would hole heartedly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Barcelona, on a budget or not. I made my reservations thru hotels.com based on reviews I read on tripadvisor.com. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at the Itaca”
Reviews.Author: Katya10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. Nicely close to a RENFE station, but not close to much of anything else, including any good restaurants. It's a good ten minute walk to a Metro stop, and then a few stops down to get to La Rambla. Compared to our stay in Madrid, after a few days we were sick of walking. No room service at this hotel, although the restaurant is nice and the staff is friendly. Good bar in the lobby. Our last 24 hours there, a large group must have come in because the noise level increased ten-fold and was VERY annoying. Equally annoying was the shower temperature - which regularly fluctuated while one was taking a shower. With the exception of the restaurant staff, hotel staff was neutral towards us, at best. They seemed perpetually busy at the front desk, with nary a minute to answer any questions courteously. What was most frustrating, however, were the lack of directions for how to use ANYTHING. I had to ask how to use the phone, my husband, after a half hour, finally figured out how to hook up our laptop to the wireless internet access, which costs money per hour. We could barely figure out how to turn on the lights. Absolutely nothing. I found it inconsiderate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: gymeddie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews. I booked it primarily for the location as I heard that many hotels near Las Ramblas were quite noisy. The location was excellent with the metro being a few minutes walk away and didn't take long to get us into the centre of Barcelona. The room was lovely-very clean and well maintained. We were on the main road side and were grateful for the soundproofed windows. Although you can still hear the traffic it certainly didn't hamper our sleep! The staff were very friendly, helpful and cheery. We would stay here again on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “what a treat”
Reviews.Author: peterudd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite simply perfect. From the friendly, English-speaking staff and the glass of complimentary Cava on arrival to the nicely-sized, well equiped rooms it was joy to stay at this hotel. I could not recommend this place highly enough for the reasonable mid-range cost. It is well situated, 5 minutes walk from the Estacio de Sants where train, metro, buses and taxis are continually available. From there a 5 minute metro ride had us in downtown Barcelona savouring the sights, sounds and tastes of this beautiful city. Any request made of the hotel staff was dealt with speedily and with good grace. The restaurant menu looked very good but due to time constraints we never got to try their offerings. Each evening, snacks and free mineral water were always available to guests who retired to the canvas covered reception room - very chic. The rooms were well-serviced but my only gripe would be the lack of a kettle and tea/coffee available in the rooms. There was a selection of self-heating drinks available which just seemed too odd and too instant for our liking. The fridge in the room also proved very useful. All in all, WHEN I return to Barcelona (very soon I hope) I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Thankyou TripAdvisor for introducing me this hotel in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, shower temperature was very inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but way too expensive for what you get. I would rather stay at the other hotel we were at in Barcelona that was half the cost and was not half the amenities. I expected more from H10, given that it was twice more expensive than the other hotel we are at earlier in the week. We stayed at H10 to splurge ourselves for our last night in Barcelona. H10 came way short. At close to the top of the list was that the best bed they could give us two twin beds pushed together rather than one queen or king bed. The absolute most disappointing part of our stay was the shower. The shower never held a constant temperature. It was either too hot or too cold, depending on whether someone else in the building was flushing a toilet or taking a shower at the same time. I have never experienced this problem of inconsistent shower temperature in any of my previous stays at any other hotel in the world. A comfortable shower has got to be one of the most important needs for a traveler, myself included. We were thoroughly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for midprice range”
Reviews.Author: aDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good selection in the midprice range. It has helpful English speaking staff. I was pleased to see that they regularly permitted early arrivals to check in early. This is important for persons arriving from a long trip in the morning, and many hotels are unbending on checking in times. The free internet is also a great advantage;the hotel has two terminals both of which were working when I was there. The public rooms are attractive. Several English language news papers available to read. The location of the hotel is good for someone who is staying in several days and plans to visit a variety of sights in Barcelona. There is so much to see in Barcelona and the city is spread out so you may well decide to make use of public transit. I thought that the metro and bus systems were both first rate. The Tarrargona metro stop on Line 3 is most convenient, and Line 5 stop is nearby too. I found the free bus map helpful too. The five day pass for public transit or the five day pass for public transit plus museum and shopping reductions (the latter called the "Barcelona Card") is a good buy. Also the hotel is walking distance to the main train station (Sants). The airport bus and train also arrives at the train station. However, if you are just staying in Barcelona for a couple nights and wish to concentrate your time in the Ramblas and the waterfront, you will find this location inconvenient. The hotel is located in an established community of apartment buildings. The neighborhood has several large grocery stores, and other shops and cafes. No big name restaurants nearby although there are several small places serving dinner. You may wish to take metro, bus, or taxi to more active areas for dinner. The back of the hotel faces a large courtyard and children's play area for the neighborhood. It is quiet after about 9pm. Before that time, you will hear the kids if your window is open, but closing the window shut out noise. There was a very soft mechanical sound in my room. I didn't notice it except when everything else was completely silent, and I couldn't identify its origin. I don't think it would matter to the average person, but very light sleepers might notice. My main complaint was that my room was small and there was no sitting chair just an uncomfortable desk chair. The bathroom was good size and well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good...but some small things to be wary of......”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alimara Hotel a couple of years ago and really liked it. This time I wanted something a little closer to the centre. This website has never let me down and I booked the H10 based on reviews here.... First the good things...... CHAMPAGNE WELCOME.....it was very nice and a good end to our journey. ROOM ..... Was clean & tidy (although two singles pushed together does not make a double!!) BREAKFAST...Booked through the H10 website and got a good price including breakfast...Glad I did, it's the best buffet breakfast I have ever had...almost everything you could want in great quantity. FREE INTERNET ACCESS... Never really knew why people wanted this when on holiday, but it was very useful for trying to get bus times etc. also, a bank machine and big supermarket housed in the same building as the hotel. Now...the not so great things (not bad things!!!) to look out for if it is your first visit LOCATION....It is very close to the Metro & is only 15mins to Las Ramblas by underground (the best way to travel around) but don't expect to walk out of the hotel and see anything very nice around you. It's not a rough area but there is just nothing around....a few bars that didn't look great. ROOM.....Although clean as mentioned above, the hotel is on a pretty busy road and the traffic noise was non stop and quite audible with the windows shut. these are minor gripes and overall I would say the this and the Alimara where I stayed before are much the same...The Alimara has better rooms but this has better breakfast. I would definitley be happy to stay again but will probably stay somewhere else next time as I like to try somewhere different each time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but it's a bit of a walk”
Reviews.Author: kmstraveller
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. Overall, our stay was okay. We got to barcelona at 10:00 AM and they let us check in early which was nice. THe hotel is about 5-7 minute walk from the closest subway station and since there's nothing particularly special about the street its on, it can seem like a pretty long and boring walk. There doesn't seem to be air conditioning in the rooms so I can't imagine what styaing here would be like in the middle of summer. We did like the fact that there was two computers with internet connections in the lobby. It's in a pretty quiet area. There's a groccery store about a block away which is good if you want to pick up some water or snacks cheaply. I think we paid about 160 US per night which isn't the best deal. For that money, I think I'd prefer to stay somewhere a little closer to the main tourist areas and even a little closer to a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: iramcynyc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Clean, modern, comfortable - it's conveniently located next to a major train station where you can find all the lines you need to get to the airport, city centre and sights on the outskirts of town (including Camp Nou for a football match). The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, and they have a couple of computers you can use free of charge to surf the net. We preferred staying at this location to the hotels in the city centre which were in noisy and ultra - touristy areas. I would recommend H10 Itaca to anyone who is even a slightly independent traveler and is willing to spend a few minutes with a city street and public transport map. Plus there is a huge supermarket right next door that has a fantastic baked goods section that must be sampled!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: JKnowles22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the centre, but great if you don’t mind a walk or want to use the near by metro or tourist bus stop, just a couple of minutes walk away. The standard rooms are very small (including the very small double bed) and I wouldn’t want to spend more then a couple of nights at the hotel, to offset this the marble bathrooms are lovely and go some way to make up for the small room. The worse part of my stay was having a room near the stairs, the noise of people coming and going at all hours kept me awake at times, also most of the rooms have wooden floors which do by there very nature make more noise the carpet when people walk on them. The hotels good points are that it has clean rooms (all mod cons) and very friendly staff. The breakfast was great and would recommend paying the extra to eat at the hotel. Bad points are the paper thin walls, and location if you have limited mobility. Loved Barcelona would recommend the city to anyone, so much to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Louise66
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona and having read a review on TripAdvisor stayed at the Hotel Itaca. We were very pleased with the standard of the accommodation, cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff. Although the hotel is a little way from the centre, the Metro, bus/train station is only a few yards away - giving you access to every part of Barcelona. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes good quality accommodation.

HotelInfo.Name: H10 Itaca Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida de Roma 22, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
